Description: Fragment of upper part of black-figure painted pottery situla. Part of head of lion looking back and head of owl. Purple (on the plate showing darker than the medium brown paint) for lines in locks of mane and on eyeballs of lion; also on eyeballs and top and bottom parts of head of owl. Apparently from a wide, perhaps symmetrical panel. Inside not painted.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 17
Curator's comments: The fragment possibly belongs with BM GR 1952,0504.2 Cook group B4. NA-Analysis done by Prof. H. Mommsen in 2003 (Helmholtz-Institut, Bonn) revealed a group with this situale and BM GR 1888,0208.16b+17 and 1888,0208.20, just like the stamnoi Oxford 1925.608.3, BM GR 1888,0208.44a and the amphora BM GR 1888,0208.25 (S. Weber)
Findspot 17 determined by Petrie 1888, pl. xxv, 2
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B106.19)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 599, 3)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxv, 2)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 240)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (Table 1)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.207)
